top_categories.workout_context: Crystal Bear’s 192-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Crystal Bear’s northern wisconsin forest service roads, upper peninsula michigan gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Crystal Bear isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Every session at Crystal Bear intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 192 miles, Crystal Bear rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Crystal Bear rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Crystal Bear when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Crystal Bear’s northwoods rolling gravel with sandy sections and overnight navigation challenge delivers on race day.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Crystal Bear. Make this intensity feel like home.
Crystal Bear’s 8,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Crystal Bear — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

Crystal Bear’s northwoods rolling gravel with sandy sections and overnight navigation challenge and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.

race_overlay.heat: May in Laona, WI to Crystal Falls, MI can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Crystal Bear. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 192 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 192 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Crystal Bear requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on northwoods rolling gravel with sandy sections and overnight navigation challenge to build confidence. Expect: northern wisconsin forest service roads, upper peninsula michigan gravel, sandy northwoods sections.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 192 miles of northwoods rolling gravel with sandy sections and overnight navigation challenge in Laona, WI to Crystal Falls, MI.
